name: Jessenia Pothos
climate: Prefers a warm and humid climate similar to its native tropical regions.
Can tolerate a range of indoor temperatures but best between 65-80°F.
Avoid exposure to temperatures below 55°F as it can harm the plant.
Consistency in temperature without sudden changes is ideal for growth.
sunlight: Requires bright, indirect light to maintain its vibrant foliage color.
Can adapt to lower light conditions, but growth might slow down.
Avoid direct sunlight as it can scorch the leaves, causing damage.
Supplement with artificial light in very low light environments.
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry, ensuring even moisture.
Reduce watering in the winter as the plant's growth slows down.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure proper drainage.
Mist the leaves occasionally to mimic its natural humid environment.
soil: Prefers a well-draining potting mix with a balance of peat and perlite.
A lightweight, airy soil promotes healthy root development and growth.
Can benefit from slightly acidic to neutral pH levels in the soil.
Ensure the pot has drainage holes to prevent waterlogged soil conditions.
toxic: Toxic to pets and humans if ingested, causing irritation and vomiting.
extra_care_tip: Rotate the plant occasionally to ensure even growth and light exposure.
